description: This walk explores the pretty Nightingale Valley Nature Reserve in Brislington, Bristol. The reserve is something of a hidden gem with a peaceful wooded valley, streams and lots of wildlife to see. It's a popular place for dog walkers and families with a pooh sticks bridge over the Brislington Brook to play on. You can extend the walk by heading east to visit Conham River Park and Hanham Woods. There's more pleasant woodland and riverside trails in this area.
display_address: 7, Saint Annes Terrace, Broomhill, St Anne's, Bristol, City of Bristol, West of England, England, BS4 4DY, United Kingdom
